CeleganceApp ADMIN> USER SEND VERIFICATION This is Admin panel Log Out admin Settings 0 item selected ADD DisQualify Enter Message For Candidates Dancing Feet War of DJs Battle of Bands sargam Muscle Maniac Nukkad Dramaturgy Art-Attack Mobile Legends Game Raiderz Gladiator Gully Cricket Open Mic Basket Ball Splitsvilla Roadies Deadpool Dance Music Music Music Body Building Dramatics Dramatics Fine Arts Gaming Gaming Action Action Action Action Adventure Adventure Adventure

“Dance is the hidden language of the soul of the body.“ For some people dance is an art, for some it is fun, for some it is just a hobby but for some Dance is life.

What is your definition of dance of dance? the stage is all set, participate in groups and show us your talent, let the world admire your hard work and perseverance. be the winner, be the “champion”.

Rules and Regulations

Who can participate

Students who are registered in any program in an educational institute of India and have a valid identity card can participate in the event.

How to enter

Participants have to register themselves online Here for offline registration point of contact is given below.
Spot registration is available for NON CVRCE students.

General Guidelines

  • The team size has to be between 2- 20 members
  • Time limit - 5 to 8 minutes
  • the music track must be submitted (in a pen drive) one-hour prior the start of event.
  • Any dance forms are allowed
  • Fusion is allowed.
  • Judgement will be based on energy level, costumes, synchronisation and choreography.
  • Props are allowed, participants must bring their own props.
  • Exceeding the time limit will lead to negative marking.
  • Discipline is must, any form of indiscipline will lead to disqualification of that team.
  • Participants must reach the venue 1 hr prior the start of event.
  • Participants from different colleges must bring their id card with them.
  • Any form of fluid is not allowed in the stage.

Coordinators

Shubham - +919337796171
Shubhasmita- +919438184716

Welcome to Echo 1.0, Celegance, one the grandest EDM fiesta the country has ever witnessed. Echo 1.0, Celegance brings together every kind of EDM enthusiast that has ever existed be it the professionals, amateurs or the budding artists. Ever imagined jumping to those insane beat drops of your favourite dubstep tune? If so EDM night, Echo 1.0 is the right place for you to go.

With DJ war, Echo 1.0 you have a chance to showcase your talent in front of crowd of thousands and a stellar jury at the colour run. Echo 1.0, in Celegance ’18 will be an event filled with joy, vibrance and energy for which Celegance is known. With Echo 1.0, Celegnace ’18 get ready to witness the magic of electronic and feel your pulse beat.

Who can participate

Students who are registered in any program in an educational institute of India and have a valid identity card can participate in the event.

How to enter

Participants have to register themselves online Here for offline registration point of contact is given below.
Spot registration is available for NON CVRCE students.

Rules and Regulation

  • Event consist of 2 rounds
    • Round 1
      • Participant should register himself/herself before 12th march 2018.
      • It includes preliminary screening. Participant has to send an audio clip ofmax. 8 mins of their set to asitmohanty8197@gmail.com on or before 14th march 2018.
    • Round 2
      • Teams should assemble 60 minutes prior to their event happening at the designated venue.
      • Each contestant will be given 20 mins to showcase his or her ability behind the console.
      • Pre-edited/pre-mixed tracks will not be allowed. (No tempo and key correction).
      • Mashups will not be allowed. Acapellas are allowed.
      • No hardware besides what is provided by the organizers to be used.
      • Contestants shall bring their own headphones and CDs.
  • JUDGING CRITERIA
    • Mixing ability
    • Tune curation
    • Creativity shown
    • Original tracks

Coordinators

Who can participate

Students who are registered in any program in an educational institute of India and have a valid identity card can participate in the event.

How to enter

for offline registration point of contact is given below.

General Guidelines

  • During Registration, students are required to show their respective Institution Identity card and should arrive at respective place on time.
  • Each band has to perform all songs directly on the Celegance main Stage.
  • Each bands will be given total 20 mins, 5mins for preparations and 15 mins for playing music.
  • Well knownJudges are invited to come being Jury members.
  • Jury members decision is final in all directions

for offline registration point of contact is given below.

General Guidelines

STUDENTS WILL REGISTER TO SHOW THEIR MUSCLES ON THE EVE OF CELEGANCE WITH A NOMINAL REGISTRATION FEE.

    FROM ALL THE REGISTERED STUDENTS RANDOM GROUP OF 3 WILL BE MADE AND THEY HAVE TO SHOW THERE MUSCLE AND SHAPES. THE BEST OF THE 3 WILL BE QUALIFIED FOR THE NEXT ROUND

NukkadNatak is a street-play competition of Dramatics at Celegance where you speak in the lingo of the common folks to outline captivating issues which are also socially relevant. The main endeavour is to convey a social and political message in an entertaining environment, amidst the intimate and effective means of theatre by means of shout, chants, drums and catchy songs. This is your chance to be the change you think of bringing about.

Rules and Regulation

Who can participate

Students who are registered in any program in an educational institute of India and have a valid identity card can participate in the event.

How to enter

Participants have to register themselves online Here for offline registration point of contact is given below.
Spot registration is available for NON CVRCE students.

General guidelines

  • Street plays can be in Hindi or English.
  • Time limit: 25 minutes. Warning bell will be rung after 22 minutes. Teams will be penalized if they exceed the time limit.
  • Usage of abusive language is strictly prohibited and may lead to disqualification.
  • Judges collective decision will be final and binding.
  • Use of any sort of hazardous element/prop is strictly prohibited.
  • Performance should be confined within the Nuked area, as defined by the organizers
  • No technical support will be provided.
  • Teams can use banners and posters. Teams are allowed to use musical props as Dholak, Flute or any other music instrument of their choice, but usage of mikes, lights, or other electrical instruments is not allowed.
  • Team size: Maximum of 20 members including those handling music and minimum 7 members.
  • No professional assistance is permitted; all team members should be certified students of the institute. Please bring along your identity cards
  • JUDGING CRITERIA
    • Content, Theme and message-40%
    • Performance (Dialogues, Acting and Expression)-25%
    • Interaction and Improvisation – 20%
    • Direction,effects, Gimmicks – 15%

Coordinators

Ayushi Raman – +918908881397
Neha Sethi– +917978519063

If you think you can mesmerize the audience with your acting, script and dialogues – then DRAMATURGY is your call! It cannot get better than the annual stage play competition at Celegance-2K18. It is a duet event, come in pair to perform your script. The event aims to recognize the uprising talent in many unsung actors. It’s show time guys, participate and showcase your acting talent and get rewarded .”stage for couple acting maniac”

Rules and Regulations

Who can participate

Students who are registered in any program in an educational institute of India and have a valid identity card can participate in the event.

How to enter

for offline registration point of contact is given below.
Spot registration is available for NON CVRCE students.

General Guidelines

  • The event will take place in two rounds – prelims and finals.
  • The maximum time limit for each team is 10 minutes.
  • Language of the play can be in either English or Hindi.
  • The participants will have to bring their own required audio or music clips.
  • Any instance of vulgarity or disturbing contents of any order will lead to disqualification.

JUDGING CRITERIA

  • Contents – 40%
  • Acting/Expressions – 40%
  • Miscellaneous effects – 20%

Who can participate

Students who are registered in any program in an educational institute of India and have a valid identity card can participate in the event.

  • The decision of the Judges will be final and binding.

Mobile Legends: Bang Bang is a multiplayer online battle arena (MOBA) game designed for mobile phones. The two opposing teams fight to reach and destroy the enemy\'s base while defending their own base for control of a path, the three "lanes" known as "top", "middle" and "bottom", which connects the bases. In each team, there are five players who each control an avatar, known as a "hero", from their own device. Weaker computer-controlled characters, called "minions", spawn at team bases and follow the three lanes to the opposite team\'s base, fighting enemies and turrets.

Rules and Regulations

Who can participate

Students who are registered in any program in an educational institute of India and have a valid identity card can participate in the event.

How to enter

for offline registration point of contact is given below.
Spot registration is available for NON CVRCE students.

General Guidelines

  • It will be a Custom Double Draft pick tournament.
  • Each team consists of 5 members.
  • Players have to bring their own mobile phone.
  • It will be a Knockout Tournament(i.e. Once you lose you are out of the tournament).
  • Coin will be tossed for 1st pick.
  • Using profanity & cheat is strictly prohibited.
  • During the event decision taken by organisers will be final.
  • Any of the above rules, if found violated then the team will be disqualified from the tournament.

A gathering in which gamers (devotees of computer games) will gather to share a local area network(LAN) and participate in extended gaming sessions of popular games such as FIFA, Counter Strike and NFS.

Rules and Regulations

Who can participate

Students who are registered in any program in an educational institute of India and have a valid identity card can participate in the event.

How to enter

for offline registration point of contact is given below.
Spot registration is available for NON CVRCE students.

General Guidelines

These rules apply to everyone attending. They can be changed without notice.
  • You are responsible for your actions and equipment. We are not liable for anything that happens to you and your equipment.
  • Do not attempt to steal items from the event or anyone else. Legal consequences will be there.
  • Cheating is not tolerated.
  • Do not bring any type of hacks/viruses/etc. to the event.
  • Listen to those in charge.
  • We reserve the right to remove anyone from premises for any reason we fit.

Counter Strike Rules

  • Matches will be played 5 on 5.
  • Playing with fewer than 5 players in any match is permitted with captain’s agreement.
  • Use of particular console commands will be informed by the organizers on the day of tournament.
  • Players may bring their own mousepads & headphones. Mouse and Keyboards are strictly not allowed.

Need For Speed Rules

  • Cars will be provided by organizing committee.
  • Each race would have a maximum of 4 participants.
  • Each round will be investigated by organizing committee whether one player is trying to block another player or not & if it happens at that time,the player will be disqualified.
  • Each Course may be modified by the organizing committee. Players will be informed before the tournament of any such modifications.

FIFA Rules

Play until you beat everyone. Every round will be a knockout round

Event Coordinator

Binayak – +918280226346
Siddharth - +917205890069

What they do in life, echoes in Eternity. Be the modern gladiator and conquer upon your obstacles. Defy the odds and claim victory. Get a partner with whom you will become the victor. It\'s less about winning and more about not losing!

Rules and Regulation

Who can participate

Students who are registered in any program in an educational institute of India and have a valid identity card can participate in the event.

How to enter

for offline registration point of contact is given below.
Spot registration is available for NON CVRCE students.

General guidelines

  • Round 1: Blind fold
    • Every team has to solve the tambola game before proceeding further.
    • Next, one of the partners will be blind folded, and the other person has to navigate him/her in a maze created by ropes and filled with obstacles at some places.
    • Each team will get 4 mins to collect as many props in the maze without colliding with any obstacle or any other participant.
    • Each team will compete with other 3 teams.
    • The person who is blind folded should not collide with the other candidates.
    • If a person collides with the obstacles during the task then the team will get negative points as a penalty.
  • Round 2: Angry birds

    Each team will get 3 attempts to shoot the target. Team with maximum points and minimum time will be the winner.

Coordinators

ADITYA: +917978507182
MANAS: +919471351900

Gully cricket is an informal ad hoc variant game of the game of cricket, played by people of all genders and all ages in gardens, back yards, on the streets, in parks carparks, beaches and an area not specifically intended for the purpose.

Who can participate

Students who are registered in any program in an educational institute of India and have a valid identity card can participate in the event.

How to enter

for offline registration point of contact is given below.

General Guidelines

Total number of players in a team will be 6 members. The total number of team registered, will be divided into 2 groups for playing league knockout matches. The top teams from both the groups will play the final match.

Who can participate

Students who are registered in any program in an educational institute of India and have a valid identity card can participate in the event.

How to enter

for offline registration point of contact is given below.

Criteria for judgment

  • Physical Presence on the stage
  • Body language
  • Voice Modulation
  • Accuracy – Usage of accurate words
  • Dress up
  • Expression
  • Delivery (how you conclude your act, expression)

Ayush ku Nagar : 7627024247

Welcome to the world of 3x3 basketball! 3x3 basketball is a relatively new modification to the sport that is growing in popularity every year. While already being the most popular sport in the world, 3x3 is bringing in more and more people who can play this modified form of basketball!

Rules and Regulations

Who can participate

Students who are registered in any program in an educational institute of India and have a valid identity card can participate in the event.

How to enter

for offline registration point of contact is given below.
Spot registration is available for NON CVRCE students.

Defensive team not allowed to play for the ball inside the "no-charge semi-circle" area underneath the basket

3x3 Rules of the Game
Court and Ball A regular 3x3 court playing surface is 15m (width) x 11m (length)

The official 3x3 ball shall be used in all categories
Team roster 4 players

3 + 1 substitute

Note: game must start with 3 (three) players in FIBA 3x3 Official Competitions
Referee(s) 1 or 2
Time/Score keeper(s) Up to 2
Time-outs 1 per team and 2 TV-time outs, if any, at first dead ball after 6:59 and 3:59 dead ball, 30 seconds
Initial possession Coin flip

Note: the team that wins the coin flip decides whether it takes the ball or leaves it, in order to get it in a potential overtime
Scoring 1 point and 2 points, if scored behind the arc
Game duration & Score limit 1 x 10 minutes, playing time

Score limit: 21 points. Applies to regular playing time only

Note: if a game clock is not available , running time length and sudden death score is at organizer\'s discretion. FIBA recommends setting score limit in line with the game duration (10 minutes/10 points; 15 minutes/15 points; 21 minutes/21 points)
Overtime First team to score two (2) points wins the game
Shot clock

12 seconds

Note: if a shotclock device is not available , referee to warn and count down the 5 last seconds
Free throw(s) following a shooting foul 1 free throw

2 free throws, if foul committed behind the arc
Foul limit per team 6 team fouls
Penalty for team fouls 7, 8 and 9 2 free throws
Penalty for team fouls 10 and more 2 free throws + ball possesion
Possession following a successful goal Defense possession

Right underneath the hoop

Ball to be dribbled or passed to a player behind the arc
...following a dead ball Check ball exchange behind the arc (at the top)
...following a defensive rebound or steal Ball to be dribbled/passed behind the arc
...following a jumpball situation Defense possession
Substitutions In dead ball situations, prior to the check ball

The substitute can enter the game after his teammate steps off the court and establishes a physical contact with him behind the end line opposite the basket. Substitutions require no action from the referees or table officials

Notes:

*A player is considered to be "behind the arc" if neither of his feet are inside nor step the arc

**Official FIBA Basketball Rules apply for all game situations not specifically mentioned above

***Refer to 3x3 Rules of the Game text version for standings, default, forfeits, protests and disqualification

Coordinators

MOHAK ROY:8208885676
ATUL SUKLA: 9807291317

The event revolves around boys and girls trying to secure a place in "Splits villa". It is a "hunt for love" event where boys and girls compete in tasks to stay in the competition and mingle with their partners to stay in the competition. In the end, one boy and one girl are crowned the winners of Splits villa, as a couple.

Rules and Regulations

Who can participate

Students who are registered in any program in an educational institute of India and have a valid identity card can participate in the event.

How to enter

for offline registration point of contact is given below.
Spot registration is available for NON CVRCE students.

General guidelines

  • Rules on Team Structures
    • Students may participate as couple or may enter the event as individuals who eventually will be coupled.
    • According to the performance in the Personal Interview the individual students will be assigned partners.
    • Change of partners will not be entertained in the later stage.
  • Format of The Event

    The event requires participants to accept all the rules and regulations laid down by the event-coordinators for the course of the event. There will be five rounds of the event.

    • Personal Interview

      This round will comprise of questions from any field and participants need to answer to the questions wisely to satisfy the judges of the round.

    • CONNECTION

      This will be the preliminary round to see the bond between the partners involving a series of inimate tasks.

    • PHYSICAL ROUND

      This round will test the perseverance of the partners to complete the task. This will test the physical and mental strength of the partners.

    • TEST THE BOND

      This round will showcase how much the individuals are dedicated to their partners. The couples need to show their dedication towards their partner to move on to the final round.

    • FINAL SHOWDOWN

      This will be the final punch of the event which will check the chemistry and trust of the partners. The couples need to show their intimacy to impress the judges.

  • Rules
    • All rounds have their own stipulated time and will be completed in that time.
    • Participants bringing gadgets and ornaments will be at their own risk.
    • Bring your college/student I-card at the time of the event.
    • Any of the above mentioned rules, if found violated the participant would not be allowed to participate in the event.
    • Decision taken by judges and organizers will be final.

Coordinators

D.D : +917205200482
SNEHASISH : +919040501634

Roadies is a task-based contest full of adrenaline pumping actions and adventures. Here the contestants would be posed with challenges that would test their physical and mental strength.

Rules and Regulations

Who can participate

Students who are registered in any program in an educational institute of India and have a valid identity card can participate in the event.

How to enter

for offline registration point of contact is given below.
Spot registration is available for NON CVRCE students.

General Guidelines

Selection Process
  • The applicants are first asked to fill out a form and then attend a Group Discussion (GD). The form consists of basic questions regarding the applicant and includes some questions like "Why do you want to be a Roadie?" and "What is the greatest regret of your life?" etc.
  • Moderators watch the performance of all the applicants in this GD and then they shortlist the contestants who are called for the next round i.e. Personal Interview round. The interview is meant to bring out the true nature of the contestant. Here the focus would be on selecting contestants who are realand do not try to show a fake side of their personality to impress the interviewers.
  • Contestants selected from personal interview round would have to perform number of tasks which may be a group or individual task that would test their strength and agility.
  • The groups will be formed by the OC members.
  • From these subsequent numbers of tasks, the tough enough contestants would be selected and the rest would be eliminated.
  • At the end the toughest contender would bag the prized title, “Roadie of Celegance, 2k18”

Coordinators

SUSANTA: +919776239495
AKASH: +917903403255

All death racers get ready to feel the extreme power of force. As Deadpool has the strength to face every challenge. So, in this event the participants have to show their extraordinary ingenuity. It’s not easy to be strong as to challenge your opponent so both mind and muscle power leads to the path of success. This event will test one’s abilities and gives you full package of entertainment. Participants have to face several tasks by clearing one by one they can accomplish the greatness.

Rules and Regulations

Who can participate

Students who are registered in any program in an educational institute of India and have a valid identity card can participate in the event.

How to enter

for offline registration point of contact is given below.
Spot registration is available for NON CVRCE students.

General Guidelines

  • The team has to complete the Registration process to be eligible for the written round.
  • Initially only individual participation is allowed, after PI jury will form team oftwo.
  • There is no registration fee
  • During Registration, students are required to show their respective Institution Identity card.
  • Play will commence with qualifying written round and personal interview followed by subsequent rounds as mentioned below
    • Round I - WRITTEN ROUND
    • Round II - PERSONAL INTERVIEW
    • Round III - DEATH MAZE
    • Round IV - SHORTCUT TO HELL
  • The participants shall not be allowed to use mobile or any electronic device, during any stage.
  • The decision of the Judges will be final and Binding.

Coordinators

SANJEEB ROUT
Mob No - 9439315940

Dhating Naach Treasure Hunt Fast N Furious Beg Borrow Steal Xumberance Rangbazzi Dosti Not Out Dangal Filmy Deewane Game of Thrones Youth Minister Lucky Star Eat and Earn Sherlock Holmes Sumo Wrestling Dance Adventure Adventure Adventure Fashion Fine Arts Action Action Action Action Action Action Action Action Action

Where the hand goes, the eyes follow. Where the eyes go, the heart follows.” We are providing a platform where all the dancers can showcase their hard work in the most beautiful way possible and amaze the audience with the elegance of their moves.

battle and proveyour band ‘the king of bands’.
ROCK ON!!

Rules and Regulations

Who can participate

Students who are registered in any program in an educational institute of India and have a valid identity card can participate in the event.

How to enter

Participants have to register themselves online at http://celegance.cvrgi.edu.in/
for offline registration point of contact is given below.
Note : spot registration is not available for CVRCE students.

General Guidelines

  • Participants must bring their college identity card along with them.
  • Participants must reach the venue 30 mins prior to the event.
  • Any form of obscenity or inappropriate behaviour with the management, judges and crowd will result in direct disqualification.
  • The final decision regarding any matter lies in the hand of the organizers and judges and is absolutely binding.
  • All the equipment provided by the college must be handled with proper care. Participants will be charged in case of any damage.
  • Participants have to bring their sound track in a pen drive containing only the song for the performance.

No. of Round(s): 3

Team size for group dance: Min 5 members and no Maximum limit.
  • ROUND 1: AUDITION ROUND

    Participants will be given a time frame of 3 mins max. to showcase a glimpse of their performance, on the basis of which they will be shortlisted for the next round.

  • ROUND 2: PRELIMINARY STAGE ROUND
    • All the shortlisted participants from the first round will perform on the stage.
    • All the dance forms are allowed.
    • Fusion is allowed.
    • The time limit for this round will be 10 mins.
    • Exceeding the time limit will lead to negative marking.
    • Judgement will be based on energy level, costumes and props, choreography and synchronisation.
    • Any kind of fluids, powder or any other heavy object is not allowed on the stage.
  • ROUND 3: FINAL STAGE ROUND

    The Groups which will make it through the 2nd round shall compete on the finale stage infront of all the crowd, which will be held on the final day of the fest. Winner will be awarded there itself. Groups should come prepared with their final audio file.

Coordinators

Binayak - 8280226346
Siddharth - 7008033887

Our treasure hunt is an information-based puzzle hunts, in which team of 3 members use their collective brainpower to solve clues. Each team is presented with a group of puzzles, or clues, which they have to solve in order to find the respective information. It’s basically a fun-filled team building activity.

Rules and Regulation

Who can participate

Students who are registered in any program in an educational institute of India and have a valid identity card can participate in the event.

How to enter

for offline registration point of contact is given below.
Note : spot registration is not available for CVRCE students.

General guidelines

  • Round 1

    First round is basically a written round where the team has to answer the tricky questions. The team that answers maximum number of questions correctly will be selected for the second round.

  • Round 2

    This round contains puzzle solving. Team solving the puzzles quickly will qualify for the third round.

  • Round 3

    In this round, a map clue will be provided to the team members. Following the map, team has to find another clue. Team that takes minimum time to find the last clue will be selected for the final round.

  • Round 4

    In this round the finalist team will get clues and they have to find there treasure with each clue and have to derive a story out of it .The team who finds the clue fastest and also have an interesting story will be declared as winner.

Coordinators

Nitish Keshari : 9776950077
Nikita Ranjan : 7064233762

FAST N FURIOUS is the event that will bring out all the memories of endless games of faster and more furious we played since we were kids. So, pair up and gear up for a fast and furious joyride. This is a two-person event; you can register individually or in pairs. If you register individually we will pair you up on our own. The event will take place in six rounds, which will be spontaneous and surprising. You will be judged on how fast you perform the task and how furious you are while performing it.

Rules and Regulations

Who can participate

Students who are registered in any program in an educational institute of India and have a valid identity card can participate in the event.

How to enter

Participants have to register themselves here for offline registration point of contact is given below.
Note : spot registration is not available for CVRCE students.

General Guidelines

FAST N FURIOUS is the event that will bring out all the memories of endless games of more fast and more furious we played since we were kids. So, pair up and gear up for a fast and furious joyride. This is a two-person event; you can register individually or in pairs. If you register individually we will pair you up on our own. The event will take place in six rounds, which will be spontaneous and surprising. You will be judged own how fast you perform the task and how furious you are while performing it.

  • Round 1
    • You think you are fast and too furious about adventures !!
    • So buckle up with your adventurous memories since ages and gear up with hell lot of energy.
    • This Round includes a written exam which will act as an elimination round.
  • Round 2
    • Congrats your Furiosity brought you here !!
    • Round 2 consists of 4 sub-rounds

Get ready to put all your resources and contacts to a test to fetch the most radical and extraordinary things in this epic race. In this game show you can win money by begging, borrowing or stealing things. Participants will be given a list of things that they have to fetch within a time span. Everything is fair in this war. \'Jugaad\' is the key word. For once, you won\'t be ostracized for begging, despised for borrowing or prosecuted for stealing. The team which earns the maximum points in the least time will be declared winners. It\'s time to put on your shoes, fasten your belts, spruce up your imagination and put all your resources to fetch the most radical things. For once in a lifetime you won\'t be eschewed for begging, despised for borrowing or prosecuted for stealing. So, get ready to have some real fun.

Rules and Regulations

Who can participate

Students who are registered in any program in an educational institute of India and have a valid identity card can participate in the event.

How to enter

for offline registration point of contact is given below.
Note : spot registration is not available for CVRCE students.

General guidelines

Selection Process
  • Teams will have to get themselves registered before the commencement of the event.
  • A team will comprise of 3 players.
  • All the teams will be provided with a list of items.
  • Team members will have to complete the task within a time limit of 120 minutes.
  • All the teams can submit their list of items after 60 minutes.
  • If any team uses mobile phone or go to the outside of the campus to collect their listed things then that team will be disqualified.
  • If any team steals their listed thing from another team of this event then that team will be disqualified.
  • If any team tries to enter the hostels,food court, canteen, departments to collect their listed things then that team will be disqualified.
  • Teams can beg, borrow or steal the items that are enlisted and provided to them.
  • After the completion of the task the teams are required to report to the coordinators for evaluation.
  • Teams will be judged on first come, first serve basis and also the items they were able to collect.

A ramp show of a kind that showcases the talent of an individual of how he/she is able to style and adapt to the changes of emerging fashion world.

Rules and Regulations

Who can participate

Students who are registered in any program in an educational institute of India and have a valid identity card can participate in the event.

How to enter

for offline registration point of contact is given below.
Note : spot registration is not available for CVRCE students.

General Guidelines

  • This contest is open only for bonafide students of C V Raman College of Engineering.
  • All contestants must possess a valid college ID card which must be presented at the time of registration.
  • The registration form comprises two parts
    • Personal details
    • Some questions
    Both the parts have to be filled up.
  • The duly filled form, withthe questions answered is to be submitted to the person in charge. The last date of submission of the form is 14th March 2018; henceforth no applications will be accepted.
  • All contestants are required to assemble in a specified place on 15th March 2018 from 2pm onwards for the first round of screening “XPRESSION” based on
    • Written exam
    • Self introduction
    • Personality & grooming
  • Shortlisted contestants from “XPRESSION” round will participate in second round "XTEMPORE".
  • The shortlisted contestants from above round move to next round "XPLOSION" on 16thmarch 2018 ,8 AM onwards where they will be screened on the basis of
    • Talent
    • Ramp Walk
    • Stage presence
  • The top 14(7 boys ,7 girls) contestants will have to undergo a small training by our professional trainers on 17th march 2018 8 am onwards.
  • The above 14 finalist will take to stage for the final round “xumberance” on 17th March 2018 which will comprise a ramp walk.
  • The final contestants will have to comply with the following
    • Vulgarity of any kind would lead to disqualification from event.
    • No props or costume will be provided by us. Contestants have to bring their own costume and props.
    • Emphasis is given to clothing, walking style and originality.
    • Maintain punctuality, discipline and decorum throughout the event.
  • The decision of the screening panel and judges will be final and binding and cannot be challenged by the contestants.
  • A contestant can be disqualified at any point of time in the contest in case of manning committee finds any discrepancies in the information provided or any sign of misconduct on the part of the contest.
  • The venue and schedule of the rounds are subject to change and will be intimated to the contestant by SMS.

Who don\’t like watching movies, they have become a part of our lives. Movies and games are the most entertaining combos. So, execute your talent of being a movie maniac and show that you are the Einstein of movies.

Rules and Regulations

Who can participate

Students who are registered in any program in an educational institute of India and have a valid identity card can participate in the event.

How to enter

for offline registration point of contact is given below.
Note : spot registration is not available for CVRCE students.

General Guidelines

  • 1st round

    It will be a written round where question related to movies will be asked to the teams, time allotted will be 30 minutes and 12 teams will be selected for the next round based on their score.

  • 2nd round

    In this round, there will be a box containing numerous chits which will have movies/songs/dialogs written on it but in opposite language, for ex Hollywood dialogue in Hindi or vice versa etc. The participants of the team has to pick the chits one by one and guess the name of movie/dialogue/song written the chit. The participants who get the maximum number of correct answers in 2 minutes will move on to the next round.

  • 3rd round

    5-6 teams will qualify the 2nd round to be on the 3rd round. In this round the selected team must search emojis in the college campus based on the hint given to them. After finding all the emojis, they must bring the emojis back to the event coordinator where he will set the collects emojis in such an order that arranged emojis will form a name of a movie, the participants will have to guess the name of the movie , the team which complete the whole process in minimum time will be declared the winner of the event.

Rules and Regulations

Who can participate

Students who are registered in any program in an educational institute of India and have a valid identity card can participate in the event.

How to enter

for offline registration point of contact is given below.
Note : spot registration is not available for CVRCE students.

General Guidelines

There will be 3 rounds in the event
  • A UNIQUE KIND OF EXAM (for 100 registered participants)

    In this there will be 30 basic questions with four hidden choices. Participant have to choose one of the option i.e. A, B, C or D by guessing and trying their luck.

  • A SEARCH AND FIND GAME (for 30 short listed candidates)

    There will be some different coloured balloons and balls spread out in a specific area. Participants have to collect as many of them in a speculated time. And then in the end according to the colours, the points will be distributed, by disclosing the secret points table for respective colours.

  • A FINAL BATTLE (for top 10 candidates)

    In this there will be a swimming pool event where these 10 will be divided into 5 pairs and one of the person will be tied up outside the pool and second one ha s to choose a diver out of 4 given divers(4 marine cadets) to dive and find the right keys for the locks.

A murderer is on the loose. He hunts in the night, crawling on its target with utter silence and total anonymity. But he can\'t hide always because for every Moriarty, there is a Sherlock Holmes waiting to uncover his ill wills. Be the Sherlock and find the Murderer with hints and "4 dead bodies".

Rules and Regulations

Who can participate

Students who are registered in any program in an educational institute of India and have a valid identity card can participate in the event.

How to enter

for offline registration point of contact is given below.
Note : spot registration is not available for CVRCE students.

General Guidelines

  • Round 1: Brain Tease

    Participants have to solve the picture puzzles using magnifying glass and rubik cube within 3 min. The maximum no of colors joined on the rubik cube will decide the points of the team.

    The top scorers will be advanced to next level.

  • Round 2: Murder Mystery

    Participants have to solve the murder mystery of 4 people within time limit.
    4 mannequin will be placed in front of them with cut marks and weapons (guns, knives). Each team will be given a list of 4 suspects. The team has to find out the murderer by studying the clues obtained from the mannequin. The quickest of the correct answers will be advanced to the final round.

  • Round 3: Master Mind

    Candidates have to relocate the iron balls in center of the maze. Successful candidates with minimum completion time will win the event.
